instructions.name: report_drainer
docs: Report a drainer address to the on-chain registry
This instruction creates or updates a DrainerReport PDA account.
Requires a 0.01 SOL anti-spam fee.

accounts.name: drainer_report
docs: The DrainerReport PDA account (created if first report, updated if exists)

accounts.name: reporter
docs: The reporter submitting this report (pays anti-spam fee)

accounts.name: program_authority
docs: Program authority that receives anti-spam fees

accounts.name: clock
docs: Clock sysvar for timestamps

instructions.name: update_ai_metadata
docs: Update AI-generated metadata for a drainer report
This instruction allows the program authority to update AI-analyzed metadata
including attack category, methods, summary, and associated domains.

accounts.name: drainer_report
docs: The DrainerReport PDA account to update

accounts.name: program_authority
docs: Program authority (only authority can update AI metadata)
In production, this should validate against a stored authority address
For MVP, we require a signer - the actual authority is managed off-chain

errors.name: InsufficientFunds
errors.msg: Insufficient funds for anti-spam fee (0.01 SOL required)

errors.name: ReportCountOverflow
errors.msg: Report count overflow - maximum reports reached

errors.name: AmountOverflow
errors.msg: Amount overflow - total reported amount too large

errors.name: CannotReportSelf
errors.msg: Cannot report yourself as a drainer

errors.name: CannotReportSystemProgram
errors.msg: Cannot report system program as drainer

types.name: AttackCategory
docs: Attack categories enum (1 byte)

types.name: DrainerReport
docs: DrainerReport account stores aggregated information about a reported drainer address
This account is a PDA derived from seeds: ["drainer", drainer_address]
Total size: ~1,156 bytes (8 discriminator + 1,148 data)

fields.name: drainer_address
docs: The address being reported as a drainer (32 bytes)

fields.name: report_count
docs: Total number of reports received for this address (4 bytes)

fields.name: first_seen
docs: Timestamp of the first report (Unix timestamp in seconds) (8 bytes)

fields.name: last_seen
docs: Timestamp of the most recent report (Unix timestamp in seconds) (8 bytes)

fields.name: total_sol_reported
docs: Total amount of SOL reported as stolen (in lamports) (8 bytes)

fields.name: recent_reporters
docs: Last 2 reporter addresses (for tracking) (64 bytes: 2 * 32)

fields.name: attack_category
docs: Attack category identified by AI (1 byte)

fields.name: attack_methods
docs: Attack methods used (Vec<u8> - array of enum values, max 10) (4 + 10 = 14 bytes)

fields.name: ai_summary
docs: AI-generated summary (max 500 chars) (4 + 500 = 504 bytes)

fields.name: key_domains
docs: Key domains associated with this drainer (max 5 domains, 100 chars each) (4 + 500 = 504 bytes)

fields.name: ai_confidence
docs: AI confidence score (0-100) (1 byte)

types.name: DrainerReported
docs: Event emitted when a drainer is reported
